Summary: Observed a trio of blinking lights which seemed to be moving in complete defiance to normal aircraft manuvers.
divs: sighting detailsthe event occured between 3 am and 4 am during a long distance yacht race across lake erie. we were about 50 miles southeast of pt. pelee, canada. the evening sky was clear and i don't recall seeing a moon at the time of this sighting. i was on watch along with another individual at the time of this event. seeing shooting stars are not uncommon this far from land and i would often search the sky looking for the telltale blazing comet-like tail of such a star. this time, however, i saw what appeared to be a cluster of three blinking red and white lights. i gave it little importance, thinking it was just an airplane at high altitude until it began to perform sharp, abrupt manuvers an airplane just cannot perform. it would make instant, abrupt turns, moving in any direction with apparent equal ease. the lights all moved in perfect unison, leading me to think they were all part of a single craft. my watch mate also observed this same event, eventually asking me, "are you seeing this?" once we both agreed that we were seeing the same thing, we put binoculars on the lights, but they were too high to discern any object shape. after about 45 to 50 minutes of this unusual flight pattern, the lights simply vanished in the night only to return about 1\2 hour later and again repeat its earlier manuvers high above us. none of the other crew aboard the ship saw what the two of us saw that night. we talk about freely, but we are not taken very seriously by anyone we tell this story to. but i know what i saw was not a man made flying machine.
